row.column: An account in the general ledger or an account with a custodian or agent

An accounting book. A trade's membership in an accounting book determines how it is accounted for. Every trading book belongs to one and only one accounting book. An accounting book may contain many trading books. Used to find acc_book_rule_links.
Links a trade to an acc_rule based on the acc_book of the trade and the product family of the trade.

The definition of an accounting event type. Has a name and retroactivity rule and contains a list of the types of triggering events which can cause it. The set of all records in this table represents your universe of types of accounting events.
A rule that establishes accounting handling for a particular line of business.

Instructions for posting to a GL account for a combination of accting rule/accting event type/flow direction. One such combination may have many acc_rule_configs. The set of all records in this table represents your chart of accounts.
A closing date in an inventory accounting rule indicating when the inventory must be updated (usu. marked-to-market)
The triggering events which require a recomputation of this accounting event and which should trigger its accounting. All events of type INVENTORY should be set up with the value TRADE_VALUATION.
Access permissions rule allowing a product type to be traded in a book
Access permissions rule allowing a user group to carry out an Action on a certain type of deal in a certain trade status
A segment of an automatic Account name or number for use in accounting

Specifies trigger events for each advice doc, recipient org type for each doc (cpty, broker, etc.), and formatting instructions and recipient department for each doc. See also advice_specific, which specifies formatting rules for a specific recipient.
Stores Archive Records of Advice Docs
A saved copy of a formatted advice message. Formatted messages are only saved if so configured.
Advice set-up rule that specifies how, for a particular recipient, each document should be formatted/produced
List of Dataserver that are Currently Running
Stores the column names for the saved analysis
Stores the totals of the columns for the saved analysis
A cell in a saved Analysis Report
Stores the blob output for the saved analysis
An actual parameter value in an analysis_param pricing preferences set for calculating Analysis Reports
Analysis Param Items Multiple When there is Vector of values
A rule specifying what AnalysisViewer will be used to display a certain type of Analysis Report
Tabular Analysis Report results that can be displayed in an Analysis Viewer.
Column headings and column datatypes for a saved Analysis Report
Header information for a set of pricing preferences used to run a valuation or risk Analysis Report
Scratch table to store ids of cre to be archived/deleted.
Messages for netting transfers to be archived by the scheduled task ARCHIVE_TRADE
Trades to be archived by the scheduled task ARCHIVE_TRADE
Netting transfers to be archived by the scheduled task ARCHIVE_TRADE
Customized reset date(s) or manually added reset date(s) for Asian style option.
Full class Name associated with particular authorizable object
A generic product traded in a structured product deal
Audit trail record for a back office object
Like bo_posting, this is to keep the posting record of cre event.
Like bo_message, this is to keep the record of incoming event.
A trade advice like a payment message, or other message. Only the details are saved here, not the formatted document.
Archive Records of Back Office Messages
Settings for running a back office profit and loss report.
Archive Records of Back Office Postings
A back office task such as setting a rate, sending an advice, or verifying a trade.
Archive Records of Back Office Tasks
A payment or security transfer with links to its settlement instructions
Archive Records of Back Office Payments
Book associated with Task Station Config
Colors associated with Task Station Config
Dates associated with Task Station Config
Events Types associated with Task Station Config
Internal References associated with Task Station Config
Tab associated with Task Station Config
Tab Order with Task Station Config
A user's default relative date range used to load tasks into the Task Station
A task-type to be loaded into a user's custom-defined tab in the Task Station. See bo_wfw_item for the definition of the tab itself.
A user's custom-defined tab in the Task Station. See bo_wfw_event_type for the specifications of what task types will be loaded in each tab.

A workflow rule that will be evaluated to determine whether a trade, payment, or advice message may move from one lifecycle stage to the next. Each workflow step in the Calypso back office workflow can contain 0, 1, or many rules.
Type of bond partially amortizing during its lifecycle, by reducing face value amount or interest paid.
Mapping of benchmark name to physical bond

Default financial definition of a type of bond, such as the 91-day US Treasury bill. Defaults will be used by all saved, tradeable bonds that share the bond_name of the defaults. Tradeable bonds are saved in product_bond.

A trading book. Has a name and an id number and it belongs to one and only one accounting book. A book also carries labels indicating the organization that owns it, its location, and the activity that generates trades in the book.
User-defined label applied to a books to categorize it. A book_attr_value is used to sort Books (and their trades) in Book Hierarchies. See org_name and org_node.

Name of a user-defined field added to books to categorize them. A book may contain any number of user-defined fields. A book_attribute value is used to sort Books (and their trades) in Book Hierarchies. See org_name and org_node.
Store the Currency that should be displayed for particular valuation and particular product type and particular book
Archive Cash Flow Option Coupon Related
Limits on the size of the Calypso Data Server memory caches, expressed in numbers of objects
The Calypso version number and release date for this version
Starting id numbers for Calypso objects of various types. Some seed numbers are shared by a number of object types.
Extra information Associated with Cap/Swap product
A cash flow that pays compounding interest
A bond cash flow, which can be priuncipal or interest
Any cashflow, such as a swap interest flow. Keep in mind that for most swaps, the cashflows are not saved.
Dates associated with Archive Products Cash Settle Information
Dates associated with Products Cash Settle Information
Financial definition of cash settlement values for a currency and rate index, as per ISDA Cash Settlement Matrix.
Cash Settle Information of the products
Credit events for credit default swap basket.
Ability to buy or sell equity without having the stock and to receive the dividend (or part of the dividend) against a commission.
Deposit currency for the given contract. Currency in which collateral deposits are made by the client.
Contract detail record for CFD contained in the detail grid.
The Financial grid (linked to the contract). Definition of general conditions of trading for the CFD Provider.
fx_reset_id and fx_calendar columns are not used anymore, only here for migration purpose
Correlation Matrix First Axis Archive related
Archive Related Correlation Matrix Param Data
Customs Params pertaining to Correlation Matrix
Customer Quote Engine - Configuration header info
Customer Quote Engine - Quote Max Deal Size Configuration Data
Customer Quote Engine - Simple customer spread rule parameters
Customer Quote Engine - Tier x volatility customer spread rule parameters
Customer Quote Engine - Volume customer spread rule parameters
Customer Quote Engine - Customer spread rule header info
Customer Quote Engine - Default settings for tier x volatility spreads
Amount index, amount, anc currency code for a cre event.
Attribute name and its value for a particular cre event.
Credit events occur for a particular issuer.
Credit Rating Values used by various Credit Rating Agencies
An interest rate basis swap to be used as a curve underlying
A bond to be used as a curve underlying
A bond spread instrument to be used as a curve underlying
A curve underlying FRA (forward rate agreement).
A future to be used as a curve underlying
A relative money market instrument (no specific start and end dates) to be used as a curve underlying
A specific money market instrument (with specific start and end dates) to be used as a curve underlying
An interest rate swap to be used as a curve underlying
FX position rollover timing config (Beginning of Day/ EOD)
Risk parameters for various ccy pr based risk analysis
Specifications for converting each currency pair
Basic identifying information about a saved curve
Archive information for Curve Basis Header
Basic identifying information about a saved basis curve
Curve Definition like points,underlying stored as Blob
Extra information specific to Curve Dividend
Basic identifying information about a saved FX curve
Archive information of curve_fxd_header(Zero Curve FX Derived) table
Extra information specific to Curve Zero FX Derived
Archive Related information for curve_member_rt table(rule)
List of underlyings for a saved curve
Archive Related Curve Member information(curves underlying data)
A formula to replace an instrument in a curve. Usually set by the user in the Formula column of the Underlying tab of the new Zero Curve window.
Rule that specifies, for a certain underlying in a certain curve, which real time quote for that instrument should be loaded, like BID, CLOSE, etc.
Archive Related information for curve_member_link table
Custom-defined curve generation parameters not tied to an individual input quote or output point. You can add as many as you require, and user can set them in the curve generation window
A generated point on a curve
Archive information for Curve Pricing Header
Extra information specific to Curve Pricing
A pricer or rate quote for a curve underlying instrument, saved when the curve is saved
Extra information specific to Curve Repo
A specific, fixed curve point date on a simple curve
Temporary table used while loading Pricer Config
A relative curve point tenor on a simple curve, expressed in days
Basic identifying information about a curve underlying instrument. The complete definition of the underlying will be found in the appropriate curve_underlying_xx table.
A record of a call, generally from a person at a counterparty, inquiring about some aspect of a trade, rate reset, payment, or advice message.
Deliverable Characteristics Reference Entity used by OTC products
Deliverable Characteristics used by OTC products
The network location of a Calculator in the Calypso Distributed Processing System. See also disp_config.
The network location of the Dispatcher in the Calypso Distributed Processing System. See also disp_calc.
A dividend payment from an equity share
A HTML Document region definition used for Document Security Management
Min and Max Permissible size for each new domain values
Static data values to populate Calypso combno boxes, etc. This table contains nearly all of the Calypso domains
Extended information for a dual currency cash instrument
Column name for econcomic PL analysis.
Equity linked leg of a equity linked swap.
Exchange Traded Option Contract. Exchange traded equity options are "physical delivery" options.
To keep the ids for the events that have been purged.
Event type action for products such as call notice or security lending.
Definition of a trade fee type, such as a premium or brokerage fee. Actual fees are stored in trade_fee.
Fee type and amount defined between PO and a legal entity.
The page address to be used to retrieve a given quote from a given real time feed
Log created for the feed is stored here
A parameter to be fed to the reat time feed system

A set of criteria for loading (or excluding) trades. Each criterion is a filter_set_element. Used in the Workspace (as an Exclusion Filter) and in the Process Trades window. Not to be confused with a trade_filter.
Vector values associates with Filter set elements
A criterion for loading (or excluding) trades. Part of a filter_set.
A compounding period for a cash flow that pays compound interest (for example, a swap cash flow)

For a given floating interest rate index, indicates the class name of a specialized, index-dedicated cashflow class that provides more efficient handling of cashflows for floating rate trades and trade legs.
ShortCut key information for various folders
Funding rate defined between a PO and a legal entity.
A general, contract-wide definition of a future contract. Individual, tradeable expiry months of the contract are saved in product_future.
A cheapest-to-deliver underlying (usually a bond) on a future
Used to store templates for the fx arbitrage window
Funding Rate for FX Spot Position Rollover
Used to store configurations used by the fx margin hedge scheduled task
Used to store individual configurations used by the fx margin hedge scheduled task
Holiday weight factors used by volatility calculation that uses trading day time as opposed to calendar day time
A long or short position in a currency pair
Used to store templates for the fx rollover window
FX Spot Reserve set ValDate Schedule
Event weight factors used by volatility calculation that uses trading day time as opposed to calendar day time
Handy rules to generate event weight factors in a batch
Holiday duration definition used by volatility calculation that uses trading day time as opposed to calendar day time
Weekend weight factors used by volatility calculation that uses trading day time as opposed to calendar day time
Configuration table used to substitute books in trade routing
Stores full text comments attached to objects such as trades, transfers, messages, postings, etc
A set of access permissions rule giving a user group the right to use a specific trading data: books, functions, pricing environments, data filters...
Haircut rules can be used to specify discounts for margin calls and repos.
The basic definition of a city holiday calendar. The calendar's individual holiday dates are stored in holiday_date and its holiday generating rules are listed in holiday_code_rule.
Links a calendar to its holiday date generating rules. These rules are optional for a calendar, as it may consist entirely of holiday_dates.
A holiday date for a holiday calendar. The calendar must first be established in holiday_code.
A saved copy of a document associated with an advice and/or a trade, such as a signed agreement or other legal document.
Industry Hierarchy Definition name, effective date etc.
Industry Hierarchy attributes (various information pertaining to Industry Hierarchy, Industry Hierarchy Node and Industry Hierarchy Map.
Industry Hierarchy map contains the relationship between a node and a legal entity or a product.
Industry Hierarchy Node (a classification for the hierarchy)
A position (total amount of cash long or short) in a specific currency, in a specific Book, in a specific account.
A position (number of contracts long or short) in a specific contract (a Product, in a specific Book, in a specific account
Task kickoff and cutoff times for a particulat type of task in the Calypso workflow
Children of the counterparty for which the Legal Entity Agreement applies.
A user-added field saved in a le_legal_agreement
A user-added field saved in a legal_entity. The user may restrict it for use only in the contaxt of certain roles or when dealing with certain Processing Orgs.
A contact person for trading and trade advices. The contact person is usually identified based on his department (contact_type) and provides address information for the advices.
A legal agreement between a Processing Org and a counterparty or other organization. For example, a signed ISDA agreement with addenda. May contain user-defined le_agreement_fields.
A credit rating or other rating for an organization
Registration information for the legal entity
Restricts access to only the Counterparties defined for a Processing Organization. This will be tested at trade level.
Disabled Roles of particular legal entity
A saved settlement instruction that may be applied to many deals
An organization of any kind, internal or external
temporary adjustment for a limit facility
A label used to define a trading limits bucket upon which a limit will be placed.
Limits on the exposure of the organization to particular sources of risk. Commonly used criteria for configuration include counterparty, credit rating, book, product type, currency and location.
A node in a trading limits configuration hierarchy, with set minimum, warning, and maximum limits
limit filter that uses inclusion/exclusin with a group
limit filter that uses min and max range
user-defined keyword that is applied to a limit facility
amount of a limit facility used by a trade between two dates
The details of a liquidation, specifically the number of contracts liquidated and the price at which the contracts were traded initially and in the liquidation
the date that a bond pays a lottery winner redemption
Basic record saved to indicate the existence of any type of market data item
A contract between a Processing Org and a counterparty. For example, a signed ISDA2003CreditNorthAmerican agreement. May contain user-defined master_confirmation_fields.
A user-added field saved in a master_confirmation
Comment taken on a particular message id.
Description of MIME Type File Formats
Margin call configuration between PO and a legal entity.
Margin call field and it value.
Mutation information that is tied to a particular contract.
Attribute name and its value for a particular mutation event.

Netting method to net payments of a specified deal type. Each netting method is defined by its unique combination of netting keys. A netting key is an attribute of a transfer used to find matching transfers that can be netted against that transfer.
Netting Configuration associated with particular product type,legal entity and processing org
Version infomation associated with object like Holiday,Domain Values
Observable details for a mutation event.
A book hierarchy name. See org_node.
A node in a book hierarchy. A book is sorted into a node based on its book_attr_values.
Pricer configuration for abs securities (ABS panel).
Pricer configuration for credit issuer (Credit panel).
Pricer configuration for credit rating (Credit panel).
Pricer Config Credit Spread MarketData mapping
A discount curve assignment saved in a pricer_config
An index forecasting curve assignment saved in a pricer_config
Information for Prcier Configuration saved for easier retrieval purposes.
A Pricer-specific pricing parameter value saved in a pricer_config
A Product-Pricer assignment saved in a pricer_config
Pricer Config Product Specific MarketData mapping
A specific Pricer/market data assignment saved in a pricer_config for a combination of currency/Product type/Product subtype
A volatility surface assignment saved in a pricer_config
Audit of pending modification accepted in authorization mode
A to-be-approved edit to an Authorizable object, or a to-be-approved creation or deletion of an Authorizable object.
Performance leg of credit default swap.
Access Permission related to Book curreny Pair
Access permissions rule allowing a currency to be traded in a book
Access Permission related to Product Accessible by book
The liquidated and remaining open position in a particular instrument, along with profit and loss information
A user's set of curves, market data, and Pricers which he or she prefers to use in pricing financial instruments
An FX curve assignment saved in a pricer_config
A Pricer Measure's name and the class used to calculate it. A Pricer Measure is a distinct valuation type that you can pass to a Product's Pricer class for calculation.
A Pricing Environment containing a user's set of market data and pricing parameters. Contains a pricer_config, a pricing_param, a quote_set, and a base currency.
A user's PricingParameters set containing parameter settings for his/her pricing models. Made up of pricing_param_items.
A single parameter setting saved in a pricing_param set.
Domain table that establishes the name, datatype, and domain of alowed values for each pricing parameter that can be saved in a pricing_param
Exchange Code specific to product and Exchange
Stores a new type of product called Billing. A Billing Trade is a collection of Billing Fees. A Billing Fee can be a fee charged to a CPTY for an account management for instance
A buy and sell-back instrument, similar to a repo
A corporate action product, used to provide complete back office processing when a corporate action (like a coupon payment) is done
An interest rate cap or floor
For credit default swap option product.
For credit default swap Nth default product.
For credit default swap Nth loss product.
A Compound Option product, which is an option with an option as its underlying product
Primarily for fixed income products for the definition of product code.
A collateral instrument used to secure a loan. Not for repos or security lending. See product_repo_collateral and product_seclending_col.
averaging_policy and avg_rounding_policy columns are not used anymore, only here for migration purpose
averaging_policy and avg_rounding_policy columns are not used anymore, only here for migration purpose
Description of a financial Product. There is one record here for each saved Product in the system.
The tradeable future for a given expiry month. May be a bond or money market future.
A Strip deal of FX Options
An option on a product. May have American, European, or Bermudan-style exercise.
A free-form, user-added label on a product
A loan product used as a collateral in a facility repo
For OTC commodity Option production information.
A pledge of collateral between two dates
A collateral pool product used as collateral in security lending trades
A credit rating on a Product
A user-defined identifying code or keyword saved as a label on a saved Product. For example, a CUSIP number.
A security lending deal. Collateral instruments are saved in product_seclending_col.
A transfer of cash or a security
A structured interest rate derivatives deal
An option on an interest rate swap. May have American, European, or Bermudan-style exercise.
For total return swap basket product.
eXSP Product Variable which either refer to an eXSP formula or a scalar product characteristic
A variance or volatility or gamma swap
An eXSP type described as an eXSP product instance

Event message used to communicate an event in the system, such as the saving of a trade or the setting of a floating rate. Events will be saved here only when their delivery must be guaranteed. Table should be purged regularly using the Admin Monitor.
Basic information about a saved Event Config, which will contain subscriptions saved as ps_event_config records.
Part of a ps_event_cfg_name, a ps_event_config establishes a subscription of the specified Engine to a specified type of ps_event
Each row in this table represents one consumer of a saved ps_event. A record should only be purged from ps_event once all its ps_event_handling records have had their processed_b set to true.
Persistent event stored as blob for which this is no individual table like Rate Reset
Expiry dates and delivery dates for various swaptions.
A put or call option schedule on a trade
Optional Overrides for a Product Variable for a specific eXSP Product
Quote Engine - Hierarchy src quote processor parameters
Quote Engine - Single/blended src quote processor parameters
Quote Engine - Quote processor header info
Quote Engine - Validation and spread rule header info
Quote Engine - Validation and spread rule parameters
eXSP Quotable Variable representing an item which is quotable in the market e.g. Interest Rate,FX,Equity
Definition of quote type and decimals for a particular quote name.
A set of price and rate quotes. Each quote is saved as a quote_value.
A saved price or rate quote in a quote_set
Optional Overrides for a Quotable Variable for a specific eXSP Product
A distinct currency and tenor of an index, such as USD 6-month LIBOR. Firther financial details for the rate index are saved in rate_index_default
Financial definition of a rate index, such as LIBOR. Actual tenors of the index are saved in rate_index.
One entry in the run of the depository reconcilliation report
A run of the depository reconcilliatioin report
An object that is referred to by another object (see referring_object), such as StaticDataFilter, FilterSet, Curve
All objects that can refer to an object specified in the reference_object table. Ex: A StaticDataFilter can be referenced by TaskWorkflowConfig or another StaticDataFilter.
Indicates the collateral instrument for a saved repo deal
Store the user configuration for the report browser
Report panel definition (used by Report Framework)
Report Template information for various reporting windows like Trade Audit Window,TradingReport window etc
Report view definition (used by the Report Framework)
Report window definition (used by the Report Framework)
A risk analysis set containing a set of risk reports to be run and instructions for running each. Each row in the list of reports to be run is saved as a risk_config_item record.
Part of a risk_config, a risk_config_item contains the name of a risk report to be run and the instructions for how to run it and what deals to run it on.
Details for each on-demand risk item
Customized speed buttons created by individual user for launching risk analysis reports.
Item of a rule in Scenario risk analysis.
User configuration for scenario risk analyis report.
A rule in Scenario risk analysis.
A view of a Scenario risk analysis report.
Access Permission related to Product Accessible by book
The mapping of countries and security lending legal agreements
The aspects of a legal agreement specific to a security lending trade
Indicates the collateral instrument for a product_sec_lending deal

A configuration specifying which DocumentSenders will respond to which Message Event Types. For example, you might want the EMAILDocumentSender to respond to VERIFIED_TICKETs, e-mailing trade tickets to the responsible people on the desk.
store the possible settlement methods and the info in order for a settlement method to be used. Only valid in case the SDISelector is set to 'SDISelectorAlternate'
rule for specifying how are the receivers of a settlement message (the agent, the agent of the cpty). If set, override the logic set at the Settlement Instruction
Customized Sort order per user for use in reports
Speed Button information to capture often used trade or risk data, used in CWS
A specific date point on a simple volatility surface
A leg of an interest rate swap. Always has a parent swap deal saved in product_swap.
Used with task_event_config to specify what tasks a user group can see in the Task Station. Provides a list of the books whose tasks are visible to the user group.
Auxiliary table to complete linked tasks at TaskEngine start.
Used with bo_task_book_config to specify what tasks a user group can see in the Task Station. Provides a list of the event types whose tasks are visible to the user group.
Used to specify that a saved product_ record (as indicated by the product_id in this table) is actually a trade template rather than a traded Product.
Predefined termination date(s) for a swap with early termination option, regardless it is mandatory or not.

Temp table used to load non-cached trades by trade filters.This table is not used if all trades are cached.It holds requestId,tradeId, and version at time of selection.Rows are removed per request id after loading the TF.All rows are dropped at startup
A set of bundled trades. Any number of any type of trades may be bundled.
A fee on a trade. To find the details of the fee type, see the table fee_definition.
Min Max Criteria related to Trade Filter Attribute
A set of criteria for loading trades. Each criterion is a trade_filter_crit. Used in the Portfolio Manager, the Position Keeper, and in running Risk Analyses. Not to be confused with a filter_set.
A criterion for loading trades. Part of a trade_filter.
A free-form, user-added label on a trade
Note or comment taken for a particular trade.
A trade's remaining open position, which the system will add to all the other trade_open_quantities of a given Product, Book, or Currency in order to compute a pl_position.
An allocation of a specified amount of a trade's value to a certain LegalEntity. Used for notation only and does not affect actual payments or NPV calculations.
Trade Template Keywords that can be used

The rules for generating a particular type of cashflow or security transfer for a certain trade. A trade will have as many TradeTransferRule objects as it has distinct types of cashflows/security transfers.
Name of a tree structure used in the definition of a Scenario risk analysis (scenario params).
A node of a tree structure used in the definition of a Scenario risk analysis (scenario params).
Min Max Dates Criteria related to Trade Filter Attribute
TriggerSwaption table to store Trigger Information
A user's application default settings, used primarily to set trading and valuation defaults
A Calypso user group. See user_group_member for a list of the members in each group.
Login information of user logining into dataserver using various clients application
A Calypso user. The user must be assigned to a user group in order to gain application usage permissions.
A rule specifying that a user will be able to view a Book and its contents from his Trade Viewer window.
A rule specifying that a user will be able to view a trade bundle and its contents from his Trade Viewer window.
A user's saved column configuration for his/her workspace blotter
Definition of viewer of a particular user.

A user's real time settings, as set in the Trade Viewer. The timer_interval is the frequency, in milliseconds, with which the val datetime will be made current. The real_time_b indicates whether the user will be alerted when market data changes.
A rule specifying that a user will be able to view a Legal Entity and its contents from his Trade Viewer window.
A user's custom menu item in the Trade Viewer window
A rule specifying that a user will be able to view a portfolio (a trade_filter) and its contents from his Trade Viewer window.
A user's preference setting for his/her workspace blotter. This free-form table allows all types of settings.
A specification that a user will see a certain workspace. A user can see any workspace but can only modfy his/her own. See work_space and related tables for the definition of each workspace.
A data member in a VaR dataset
Establishes membership of a risk factor (an asset, for example) in a VaR dataset
Volatility measures for a risk factor in a VaR dataset
A risk factor such as an asset which will be used in VaR analysis
Store Vol Surface Point as blob if propery SAVE_PTS_AS_BLOB is true
Archive related information for VOL_PT_BLOB table
Archive related information for vol_surf_exptenor table
A point on the term-to-option-expiry axis of a volatility surface
Archive related information for vol_surface_member table
A user-added parameter used in generating a volatility surface
Archive related information for vol_surface_point table
A price or rate quote used to generate a derived volatility surface
An underlying option used to generate a derived volatility surface
General header information about a vol surface underlying instrument. The definition of each underlying can be found in one of the vol_surface_under_ tables.
An underlying cap or floor used to generate a derived volatility surface
An underlying future option used to generate a derived volatility surface
Underlying fx option for volatility surface generation.
An underlying option used to generate a derived volatility surface
An underlying swaption used to generate a derived volatility surface
Archive related information for VOL_SURFACE_HIST table
Membership of an underlying instrument in a derived volatility surface. The definition of each underlying can be found in one of the vol_surface_under_ tables.
A plotted volatility value at a point on a volatility surface
A point on the option-strike axis of a volatility surface
A point on the tenor-of-underlying axis of a volatility surface
Archive related information for vol_surf_param table
Archive related information for vol_surf_pointadj table
Archive related information for vol_surf_qtvalue table
Archive related information for vol_surface_tenor table
Table used to store the Watcher (Administrative Tool) memory setting
Table used to store the Watcher (Administrative Tool) setting
Custom Rule that can be specified in WorkSpace

A workflow step establishing one possible transition that can move a trade, payment, or message from one lifecycle stage to another. For example, the step PENDING/AUTHORIZE/VERIFIED creates the AUTHORIZE action to move trades from PENDING to VERIFIED.
A saved Calypso workspace, which is a blotter that provides context for working with trades and helps the user track his/her trades. The details of the workspace are saved in the work_space_ tables.
A rule specifying that trades in the specified trading book should be displayed in the workspace, provided the user has clicked the Show All Trades checkbox ON.
A rule specifying that trades in the specified trade bundles should be displayed in the workspace, provided the user has clicked the Show All Trades checkbox ON.
A rule specifying that speficied workspaces should be displayed in the workspace.
A rule specifying that trades that match the specified filter set should be displayed in the workspace, provided the user has clicked the Use Excl Filter checkbox ON.
A rule specifying that trades in the specified portfolios (trade filters) should be displayed in the workspace, provided the user has clicked the Show All Trades checkbox ON.
A rule specifying that a trade should be displayed in a workspace
Additioanl data for Xccy Swap product
Maps eXSP subtypes to a specific eXSP type
Settings for Template Variable for a specific eXSP product
